abstract: Lawsuit by child advocacy groups alleges that Arizona's child welfare system routinely removes children from unstable families only to place them in worse circumstances and that state has been slow to reform foster care system; suit resulted in ouster of Charles Flanagan as director of Dept of Child Safety and installation of his replacement Gregory McKay, police officer who blew whistle on system's failings.
lead_paragraph: Two advocacy groups that filed a lawsuit last month against the state say children are being rescued from one bad situation only to end up in another one.

headline.main: As Arizona Struggles to Fix Foster System, Children Suffer the Consequences
headline.print_headline: In Arizona, Struggles to Overhaul Foster Care

snippet: Two advocacy groups that filed a lawsuit last month against the state say children are being rescued from one bad situation only to end up in another one.
